definitions: the art of producing beautiful handwriting using special pens or brushes
examples: She studied Chinese calligraphy for five years with a master
The wedding invitations featured elegant calligraphy in gold ink

definitions: a strong inner impulse toward a particular course of action especially when accompanied by conviction of divine influence
the particular occupation for which you are trained or feel suited
examples: She felt a calling to help disadvantaged children through education
His spiritual calling led him to join the monastery
Teaching wasn't just her job, it was her true calling
He finally found his calling as a wildlife photographer

definitions: a musical instrument consisting of steam whistles played from a keyboard
examples: The circus calliope played cheerful tunes before the show
You could hear the riverboat's calliope from miles away

definitions: a state of tranquility and absence of agitation or disturbance
examples: The calm before the storm made everyone nervous
She maintained her calm despite the chaos around her

definitions: the act or process of making someone or something become tranquil
examples: The calming of the crowd took several minutes
Regular meditation helps with the calming of anxious thoughts

definitions: a unit of energy used to measure the energy value of foods
examples: This salad contains only two hundred calories per serving
Athletes need to consume more calories during training season

definitions: a ceremonial pipe used by Native American peoples, especially as a token of peace
examples: The chiefs passed the calumet during the peace ceremony
The museum displayed an ornate calumet from the nineteenth century

definitions: the hill outside Jerusalem where Jesus was crucified according to the Gospels
an experience of intense mental or physical suffering similar to crucifixion
examples: Pilgrims visit Calvary to pray at the site of crucifixion
The chapel contains a painting depicting Christ at Calvary
Her battle with cancer was a personal calvary lasting years
The refugees endured their own calvary crossing the desert

definitions: the process of giving birth to a calf by a cow
the breaking away of ice masses from a glacier or ice shelf
examples: The farmer monitored the cows closely during calving season
Calving typically occurs in early spring on this ranch
Scientists observed massive calving events at the glacier's edge
Climate change has accelerated calving rates in Antarctic ice shelves

definitions: a style of Caribbean music and dance originating in Trinidad, with satirical lyrics
a tropical orchid with delicate flowers found in North America and Eurasia
examples: The band played traditional calypso at the beach festival
Harry Belafonte popularized calypso music in the United States
The rare calypso orchid blooms in shaded forest areas
She photographed a pink calypso growing near the stream

definitions: a rotating wheel or cylinder with an irregular shape used to convert rotary motion to linear motion
examples: The engine's cam controls the opening of the valves
A worn cam can cause poor engine performance

definitions: mutual trust and friendship among people who spend time together or share experiences
examples: The team developed strong camaraderie during their championship season
Military service creates a unique camaraderie among veterans

definitions: a slight convex curve built into a road surface for drainage
the angle at which a vehicle's wheels tilt inward or outward from vertical
examples: The road's camber helps water drain toward the gutters
Engineers designed proper camber to prevent water pooling
Incorrect camber causes uneven tire wear on your vehicle
The mechanic adjusted the camber for better handling

definitions: a portable electronic device that combines a video camera and recording system
examples: He recorded his daughter's graduation with his new camcorder
Digital camcorders replaced tape-based models in the early 2000s

definitions: a large mammal with one or two humps used for transportation in desert regions
examples: The caravan crossed the Sahara with twenty loaded camels
Camels can survive weeks without water in harsh conditions

definitions: an evergreen shrub with glossy leaves and showy flowers native to Asia
examples: The garden featured white and pink camellias blooming in winter
She wore a fresh camellia pinned to her evening dress

definitions: a piece of jewelry with a carved raised design on a background of different color
a brief appearance or role by a well-known person in a performance
examples: Her grandmother's antique cameo brooch featured a woman's profile
The museum displayed Roman cameos carved from precious stones
The director made a surprise cameo in the final scene
Several celebrities had cameo roles in the comedy film

definitions: a device for recording visual images in the form of photographs or video
examples: She bought a professional camera for her photography business
Security cameras monitor the building twenty-four hours daily

definitions: a person whose profession is operating a camera for film or television
examples: The cameraman captured stunning footage of the wildlife documentary
An experienced cameraman knows how to frame each shot perfectly

definitions: patterns or materials designed to conceal by disguising or blending with surroundings
examples: Soldiers wore desert camouflage during the Middle East deployment
The chameleon's natural camouflage makes it nearly invisible

definitions: a place with temporary accommodations of tents or cabins used for recreation or military purposes
an organized program of activities for children during summer vacation, often residential
a deliberately exaggerated or theatrical style that is considered amusing
examples: The scouts set up camp near the lake shore
The military camp housed five thousand soldiers
She attended music camp every summer throughout high school
The camp offers swimming, crafts, and outdoor adventures
The movie's camp humor appealed to cult film enthusiasts
Drag performances often embrace camp as an art form

definitions: an organized series of actions intended to achieve a particular goal, especially in politics or business
a series of military operations intended to achieve a particular objective in war
examples: The presidential campaign lasted eighteen months before election day
The company launched an advertising campaign for their product
Napoleon's Russian campaign ended in devastating defeat for France
The desert campaign required special equipment and tactics

definitions: a person who works actively to bring about political or social change
examples: Environmental campaigners protested outside the oil company headquarters
She became a tireless campaigner for disability rights

definitions: the activity of working systematically to bring about political or social change
examples: Months of campaigning exhausted the candidate and her staff
Online campaigning has transformed modern political strategies

definitions: a tall, freestanding bell tower, especially one associated with a church in Italy
examples: The famous campanile of St. Mark's dominates Venice's skyline
The university's campanile chimes every hour throughout the day

definitions: a person who spends a vacation or leisure time camping outdoors
a vehicle equipped for camping with sleeping and cooking facilities
examples: The campers gathered around the fire to roast marshmallows
Experienced campers know how to leave no trace
They traveled across country in their new camper van
The camper has a small kitchen and sleeping for four

definitions: a fire built outdoors for warmth, cooking, or social gathering while camping
examples: They told ghost stories around the campfire until midnight
The campfire crackled as they cooked dinner over it

definitions: an area of land equipped with facilities for people to camp with tents or recreational vehicles
examples: The campground offers electrical hookups and hot shower facilities
We reserved a spot at the lakeside campground months ahead

definitions: a white crystalline substance with a strong aromatic odor used in medicine and mothballs
examples: The old chest smelled strongly of camphor from mothballs
Camphor oil provides relief for minor aches and pains

definitions: the activity of spending time outdoors in a tent or recreational vehicle
examples: We're going camping in the mountains this weekend
Camping teaches children valuable outdoor survival skills

definitions: a specific place where people set up a tent or park a camper
examples: Each campsite has a picnic table and fire ring
They found the perfect campsite overlooking the valley

definitions: a shaft with attached cams that operates the valves in an internal combustion engine
examples: The broken camshaft caused the engine to lose power
Modern engines use overhead camshafts for better performance

definitions: a cylindrical metal container used for storing food or beverages
examples: She opened a can of tomato soup for lunch
Recycling aluminum cans helps reduce environmental waste

definitions: an artificial waterway constructed for navigation, irrigation, or drainage purposes
a tubular passage or channel in the body for conveying fluids or other substances
examples: The Panama Canal connects the Atlantic and Pacific oceans
Barges transport goods along the canal system daily
The doctor examined her ear canal for signs of infection
The root canal procedure took two hours to complete

definitions: an unfounded rumor or story that is deliberately false or misleading
examples: The newspaper retracted the canard about the senator's finances
That old canard about vaccines has been thoroughly debunked

definitions: a small yellow songbird often kept as a pet, originally from the Canary Islands
something that serves as an early warning of danger or problems
examples: Her pet canary sang beautifully every morning at dawn
Wild canaries are actually greenish, not bright yellow
Coal miners used canaries as early warning systems for toxic gases
Rising unemployment serves as the canary in the economic coalmine

definitions: the act or instance of calling off or making void
examples: The storm forced a cancel of all outdoor events
Last-minute cancels create problems for the restaurant

definitions: the action of canceling something that has been arranged or planned
examples: Flight cancellations stranded thousands of passengers at airports
The concert cancellation disappointed fans who traveled for hours

definitions: a disease caused by uncontrolled division of abnormal cells in the body
the fourth astrological sign in the zodiac, represented by a crab
examples: Early detection greatly improves cancer survival rates
The research focuses on new cancer treatment methods
People born under Cancer are said to be nurturing and emotional
Cancer season begins on the summer solstice

definitions: the state or condition of being a candidate for an office or position
examples: She announced her candidacy for mayor at the press conference
His candidacy gained momentum after the televised debate

definitions: a person who applies for a job or is nominated for election
someone or something considered suitable for a particular purpose or likely to experience something
examples: The company interviewed twelve candidates for the position
Both presidential candidates participated in three debates
This patient is an excellent candidate for the new treatment
The old building is a prime candidate for renovation

definitions: the position or status of being a candidate, especially in British English
examples: He withdrew his candidature before the final ballot
Her candidature received support from several party leaders

definitions: a cylinder of wax with a wick that burns to produce light
examples: She lit candles to create a romantic dinner atmosphere
The power outage forced them to use candles for light

definitions: the soft, flickering light produced by burning candles
examples: They enjoyed dinner by candlelight on their anniversary
The candlelight cast dancing shadows on the walls

definitions: a holder with a socket or spike for securing a candle
examples: The silver candlesticks were wedding gifts from her grandmother
She placed brass candlesticks on the dining room table

definitions: the quality of being open, sincere, and honest in expression or speech
examples: The CEO's candor about company problems surprised shareholders
I appreciate your candor in discussing this sensitive issue

definitions: a sweet food made with sugar or chocolate
examples: Children collected bags of candy on Halloween night
The shop sells homemade candy in dozens of flavors

definitions: a stick used as a support or aid when walking, especially by elderly or disabled people
the hollow jointed stem of tall grasses, especially bamboo or sugar cane
examples: He uses a cane to help with balance after his injury
The antique cane had an ornate silver handle
Sugar cane grows abundantly in tropical climates
They harvested bamboo canes for building materials

definitions: relating to or characteristic of dogs or the dog family
a pointed tooth between the incisors and premolars in mammals
examples: The veterinary clinic specializes in canine health care
Canine behavior varies significantly between different breeds
Human canines are less pronounced than those of carnivores
The dentist noted decay in her upper left canine

definitions: punishment by beating with a cane or stick, especially as school discipline
the craft of weaving cane strips to make chair seats and backs
examples: Several countries have banned caning in schools entirely
The prisoner received six strokes of caning for theft
She learned traditional caning techniques from her grandmother
The antique chair needs professional caning repair
